<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Some DWARF operations, e.g. DW&#95;OP&#95;entry&#95;value, need to calculate the size</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// of a succeeding DWARF block before the latter is emitted to the output.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// To handle such cases, data can conditionally be emitted to a temporary</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// buffer, which can later on be committed to the main output. The size of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// temporary buffer is queryable, allowing for the size of the data to be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// emitted before the data is committed.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="172"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Emit a partial DWARF register operation.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="173"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="174"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param MachineReg           The register number.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="175"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param MaxSize              If the register must be composed from</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="176"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                             sub-registers this is an upper bound</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="177"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                             for how many bits the emitted DW&#95;OP&#95;piece</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="178"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                             may cover.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="179"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="180"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// If size and offset is zero an operation for the entire register is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="181"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// emitted: Some targets do not provide a DWARF register number for every</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="182"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// register.  If this is the case, this function will attempt to emit a DWARF</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00183" /><CodeLine lineNumber="183"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// register by emitting a fragment of a super-register or by piecing together</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00184" /><CodeLine lineNumber="184"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// multiple subregisters that alias the register.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00185" /><CodeLine lineNumber="185"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00186" /><CodeLine lineNumber="186"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\return false if no DWARF register exists for MachineReg.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00187" /><CodeLine lineNumber="187"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dwarfexpression-2/#a57484713254f31f8412d08ff85259761">addMachineReg</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targetregisterinfo">TargetRegisterInfo</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machinesink-cpp/#a0f36ed1bc17fc1aa97fe291c439a0698">TRI</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">llvm::Register</a> MachineReg,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="203"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The proper way to describe a constant value is DW&#95;OP&#95;constu &lt;const&gt;,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="204"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// DW&#95;OP&#95;stack&#95;value.  Unfortunately, DW&#95;OP&#95;stack&#95;value was not available</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="205"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// until DWARF 4, so we will continue to generate DW&#95;OP&#95;constu &lt;const&gt; for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="206"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// DWARF 2 and DWARF 3 Technically, this is incorrect since DW&#95;OP&#95;const</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// &lt;const&gt; actually describes a value at a constant address, not a constant</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="208"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// value.  However, in the past there was no better way to describe a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="209"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// constant value, so the producers and consumers started to rely on</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="210"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// heuristics to disambiguate the value vs. location status of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="211"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// expression.  See PR21176 for more details.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="212"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dwarfexpression-2/#a93f0796a16275cd71f21761c339cd19f">addStackValue</a>();</span></CodeLine>
